resources.string: MBA01

1. Specific Knowledge and Skills: Each student should obtain specialized knowledge and skills for the creation of value through integrated operations and distribution of goods, services, and information.
2. Communication:Each student can effectively communicate, either written or oral.
3. Ethical Reasoning & Global Context:Each student can effectively present information orally.

4. Problem Solving & Information Technology:Each student can work through the problem solving process using information technology to identify a problem, evaluate soluctions, and devise an innovative strategy to achieve a desired goal.
The goal of our Staff is to help students prepare, plan, and perform to graduate our program by providing knowledge, resources, and support.
The MBA Student Ambassadors are a group of student leaders dedicated to representing the MBA program at California State University San Bernardino.
1. The fostering of international and intercultural exchange amongst a diverse business student body.
2. The ability to generate internship opportunities for our business students.
3. The promotion of career development.
4. Establishing a network of local, national and international employers.
5. The enrichment of leadership and public speaking skills.
MBA Student Ambassador are students who have demonstrated a high potential for academic success, community service, fostering diversity, and responsible leadership.

Ambassadors are selected through a nomination process and are appointed by unanimous vote of the MBA staff. Only MBA program students are eligible for nomination and Ambassadors are held to the highest standards of excellence.
Various events will be hosted by the Student Ambassadors throughout the academic year. Such events will be announce via email.

The Jack H. Brown College of Business and Public Administration values joint research opportunities with faculty and students. As such, each quarter the college funds a number of eligible candidates to be graduate and research assistants (GA). Please note: There are currently three offices under the College of Business that handle the hiring details for graduate/lab assistants.

1. Leadership– This passport will serve as a guide to signature activities being offered by the college. At the end of the academic year, MBA students who earn seven stamps on activities/events that represent the MBA Program Learning Goals will be awarded with an MBA Leadership Certificate.
2. Learning Goals: [click here]

3. More than a Degree – By completing your MBA Passport you will have the advantage of letting future employers know that you did more during your graduate degree than attend course and obtain high marks. This program will allow you to network with fellow students, alumni, and faculty. This is a sure way to build your resume.
